Class Gradient

java.lang.Object
com.gradient.Gradient
Direct Known Subclasses:
SmoothGradient
public abstract class Gradient extends Object
Abstract base class representing a sparse definition of a color gradient.

This class stores a set of discrete color nodes indexed between 0.0 and 1.0, which serve as anchors in a conceptual continuous gradient. Concrete subclasses of Gradient must implement the process(double) method to define how to interpolate between these nodes and compute the resulting color at any intermediate point.

This design avoids storing an entire continuous gradient in memory. Instead, it provides a flexible, on-demand way of generating colors using various interpolation strategies. Color nodes can be dynamically added and removed, and optimized caching is employed to avoid recomputation where possible.

To function correctly, the gradient must have defined colors at both ends (0.0 and 1.0). Otherwise, interpolation is undefined and GradientException will be thrown.

Author:
George Miller

  • Method Details

    • addColor

      public void addColor(GradientEntry entry)
      Add a new color node to this Gradient.
      Parameters:
      entry - Entry to be added to gradient entry list.

    • removeColor

      public void removeColor(GradientEntry color)
      Removes a previously inserted color node from this Gradient.
      Parameters:
      color - Color to be removed from gradient node list.

    • gradientFormed

      public boolean gradientFormed()
      Determines whether or not a continuous color gradient can be formed from this Gradient or not. This is the case if the Gradient has one point at its beginning and at its end so any point can be indexed in between.
      Returns:
      Returns true if a continuous color gradient can be created from this Gradient, false if it can't.

    • getColor

      public int getColor(int index, int length) throws GradientException
      Get the color at a certain point along a continuous color gradient that this instance of Gradient represents. Used to make a fixed gradient array.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the point from 0 to length.
      length - The length of the fixed gradient array this method is building, in elements.
      Returns:
      The color at this element of the fixed gradient array.
      Throws:
      GradientException - Gradient doesn't have start and end values yet, so a continuous color gradient can't be computed.

    • getColor

      public int getColor(double index) throws GradientException
      Get the color at a certain point along a continuous color gradient that this instance of Gradient represents.
      Parameters:
      index - A value between 0.0 and 1.0, which represent the start and end of the gradient respectively, which represents the index of a continuous color gradient.
      Returns:
      The color at the point along the gradient specified by the index.
      Throws:
      GradientException - Gradient doesn't have start and end values yet, so a continuous color gradient can't be computed.

    • process

      public abstract int process(double index) throws GradientException
      The unique implementation across concrete forms of Gradient that determines the color between color entries.
      Parameters:
      index - A value between 0.0 and 1.0, which represent the start and end of the gradient respectively, which represents the index of a continuous color gradient.
      Returns:
      The color at the point along the gradient specified by the index.
      Throws:
      GradientException - Gradient doesn't have start and end values yet, so a continuous color gradient can't be computed.
